intro: Camissonia campestris, commonly known as the field camissonia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and are pollinated by insects. Camissonia campestris is often found in the western United States and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
